important_phrase: Drought conditions improved significantly in Georgia, southeastern Alabama, and the Florida panhandle
Prices remained stable and most firms continued to report having relatively little pricing power
Input costs remained mostly stable
Credit spreads remained tight and some bankers reported downward pressure on loan pricing
Contacts noted profit margins slightly improved from mid-February through March
Most indicated that home prices rose modestly compared with a year earlier
District automotive contacts cited favorable sales for the same time period
Retailers generally cite slower than expected sales, and tourism has softened, partly on account of unseasonal weather
Most of the rest were optimistic or "cautiously optimistic
In Hartford, the outlook remains cautiously optimistic
Inventories are in good shape, and any price increases are moderate
Cold weather delayed field work during the reporting period, but there was little concern expressed by contacts that planting would be seriously delayed
Manufacturing production growth slowed

Delinquency rates held steady or declined across consumer and commercial loan categories
Raw material and finished goods prices were flat or trended lower
Residential builders are hiring at a moderate pace, especially field personnel
